column1: Analyze your dataset by using Pandas functions to answer the following questions:
How many months exist on Mars?
Answer:  There are 12 months on mars.
How many Martian (and not Earth) days worth of data exist in the scraped dataset?
Answer:  There are 1867 sols(days) on mars.
What are the coldest and the warmest months on Mars (at the location of Curiosity)?
Answer:  The coldest month on mars is month 3 (March?).

column2: The hottest month on mars is month 8 (August).

column1: Which months have the lowest and the highest atmospheric pressure on Mars?
Answer:  Month 6 (June) has the lowest atmospheric pressure on mars.

column2: Month 9 (September) has the highest atmospheric pressure on mars.

column1: About how many terrestrial (Earth) days exist in a Martian year?
Answer:  From the days between the coldest point in 2014 to the coldest point in 2016 (the difference between the two coldest points in the graph),

column2: there are roughly 726 days apart. This shows a martian year is roughly 726 days apart.

column1: Consider how many days elapse on Earth in the time that Mars circles the Sun once.
Visually estimate the result by plotting the daily minimum temperature of each observation.
